tutorialEntries: Another important part of Java are "Loop Statements"! Similar to "Conditional Statements" they also ask for a <condition>, but they don't differentiate between different courses of action and will run as long as the <condition> is met instead.

For our purposes write "while (true) {" and then press Enter. That means we want to repeat the following code infinitely! But don't worry it won't take an infinity to complete this level! We now want to add an if-Statement into our while-Statement.

It should check the following conditions:
<knight name>.canMove()
<knight name>.targetCellIs(EXIT)
Can you already solve this puzzle without checking the next message?
